title: How does the amount spent on home care vary by client type?
analysis_commentary: We can see that by far the largest amount spent on home care is for the over 65s, in 2013-14 was just over £1.8 million. This has however been decreasing since 2010-11, where it was at a high of £2.1 million. The amount spent on home care for adults under 65 with learning disabilities has seen the biggest rise and has been increasing since 1994-95; it was £0.7 million in 2013-14. Adults under 65 with physical disability or sensory impairment, also generally increased to a high in 2010-11 of £0.3 million and has stayed steady in the following years. Home care expenditure on adults under 65 with mental health needs was the smallest amount, around £0.07 million in 2013-14.
data_source: Health & social care information centre, Personal Social Services Expenditure and Unit Costs
